headlines: Covishield and Covaxin vaccine prices for private hospitals cut to ₹225 per dose
text: Serum Institute of India revised the price of Covishield vaccine for private hospitals from ₹600 to ₹225 per dose. Bharat Biotech also revised the price of Covaxin vaccine from ₹1,200 to ₹225 per dose for private hospitals. Earlier today, the Centre said, "Private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge only up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: IIIT-Lucknow student gets ₹1.2 cr package with Amazon job, institute's highest-ever
text: A final year B.Tech student at Indian Institute of Information and Technology, Lucknow, has bagged the institute's highest-ever annual salary package of ₹1.2 crore. Abhijeet Dwivedi has been hired as a software development engineer for Amazon in Dublin, Ireland, TOI reported. "I saw several videos to prepare myself for the interview. Soft skills matter a lot," Dwivedi said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Moderna recalls 7,64,900 COVID-19 vaccine doses over contamination in Europe
text: Moderna has said it is recalling 7,64,900 doses of its COVID-19 vaccine made by its contract manufacturer Rovi after a vial was found contaminated. No safety issues have been identified in the lots that were distributed in Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain and Sweden in January, Moderna added. Moderna was recalling the whole lot out of "an abundance of caution".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Coinbase suspends UPI payments option in India days after launch
text: US-based crypto exchange Coinbase has disabled the option to buy cryptocurrencies using UPI method in India. The development comes days after Coinbase launched its trading services in India and said it would allow users to buy crypto using UPI. After the launch, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) had clarified it wasn't aware of any crypto exchange using UPI.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 3 businessmen pay $55 million each for 10-day trip to Space Station
text: SpaceX on Friday launched three businessmen and a retired NASA astronaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The businessmen are paying $55 million each to Axiom Space for their 10-day trip. The crew will spend eight days on the US portion of the ISS and conduct 25 science experiments. The launch marks the first fully private mission to the ISS.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IT firm Kissflow gifts BMWs to 5 senior employees to honour their loyalty
text: Chennai-based IT firm Kissflow has gifted BMW cars worth over ₹1 crore each to five of its senior employees to honour their loyalty and commitment to the company. Kissflow CEO Suresh Sambandam said these employees have been with him right from the company's inception. Some of them hail from humble background and underwent various challenges before joining Kissflow, Sambandam added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Employees shouldn't feel pressured to answer emails late at night: Nadella
text: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that managers need to set clear norms and expectations for workers so they're not pressured to answer emails late at night. "We know what stress does to workers. We need to learn the soft skills," he added. When asked if he refrains from sending emails on the weekend, Nadella said, "I'm learning every day."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Lmaooo: Musk on Bezos-owned paper criticising his new role at Twitter
text: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "Lmaooo" in response to The Washington Post op-ed titled, 'Elon Musk's vision of 'free speech' will be bad for Twitter'. It said, "Musk's appointment to Twitter's board shows that we need regulation of social-media platforms to prevent rich people from controlling our channels of communication." World's second-richest man Jeff Bezos owns The Washington Post.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk takes poll to turn Twitter HQ in San Francisco into homeless shelter
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a poll on his Twitter account asking whether the firm's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. The poll read, "Convert Twitter SF HQ to homeless shelter since no one shows up anyway." The poll has got over 6.6 lakh votes till now, with over 91% answering yes.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Better.com, which fired 900 staff over a Zoom call, plans to cut its staff further
text: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which fired 900 employees over a Zoom call last year and began firing 3,000 India and US employees last month, plans to cut its workforce further. It's offering some employees as much as 60 days of severance pay and health insurance if they agree to quit. A Better.com spokesperson confirmed the voluntary separation offers to Bloomberg.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's forex reserves fall by $11.173 billion in steepest weekly fall ever
text: India's foreign exchange reserves slid by $11.173 billion to $606.475 billion in the week ended April 1, marking the steepest weekly fall ever, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. This is the fourth consecutive weekly fall in the country's forex reserves. The latest weekly decline in reserves was due to a plunge in foreign currency assets (FCAs).
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Akshata Murthy, wife of UK minister Rishi Sunak, is richer than the Queen: Report
text: Akshata Murthy, the wife of British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and daughter of Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy, is reportedly richer than the Queen, whose personal wealth is about £350 million. With an estimated fortune of £690 million (over ₹6,834 crore), 42-year-old Akshata owns a 0.9% stake in Infosys, worth £430 million. She also receives about £11.5 million in annual dividends.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: UK FM Sunak considered resigning over criticism of wife's tax status: Report
text: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak considered whether he should resign after facing criticism over his wife Akshata Murty's non-domiciled tax status, The Sunday Times reported. "He was considering whether he could withstand his family taking this any more," the newspaper quoted a source as saying. Murty's non-domiciled tax status meant she didn't have to pay UK taxes on global earnings.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UK FM Sunak's wife Akshata to pay UK taxes on global earnings amid criticism
text: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's India-born wife Akshata Murthy said she'll pay UK taxes on her global earnings following a row over her non-domicile status. Noting that her tax arrangements are "entirely legal", Murthy said, "I do this because I want to...I do not wish my tax status to be a distraction for my husband or to affect my family."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UK probes leak of Finance Minister Sunak's wife's tax affairs: Reports
text: The UK has reportedly launched a Whitehall inquiry into how the tax affairs of Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty were leaked to the media. Sunak was recently criticised after it was revealed that Akshata holds a non-domiciled status in the UK. Following the row, Akshata said that she will start paying UK taxes on her overseas income.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: My Infosys stake is testament to my father Narayana Murthy's work: Akshata
text: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty said, "My long-standing shareholding in Infosys is not just a financial investment but also testament to my father's (NR Narayana Murthy) work." The couple recently faced criticism over Akshata's 0.9% stake in Infosys and her non-domicile status. Akshata has said that she will start paying UK taxes on all her overseas income.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We've become debt-free, repaid ₹2,925 crore loans: Ruchi Soya
text: Edible oil major Ruchi Soya has said that it has repaid ₹2,925 crore loans to banks and has become a debt-free company. The money was paid to a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India. Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved-led Ruchi Soya has recently raised ₹4,300 crore through its follow-on public offer.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: We need 1% increase of rates: Kotak as RBI raises inflation forecast to 5.7%
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak questioned the RBI's decision to raise retail inflation projection and keep repo rates unchanged. "RBI policy: Sharp increase in inflation estimate to 5.7%...Present repo rate at 4%," Kotak tweeted. "If India has to move to 0% real rate that is, inflation - interest rate = 0, we need 1% increase of rates," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's 5th richest man Damani reduces Blue Dart stake, hikes stake in VST: Report
text: Radhakishan Damani, DMart owner and India's fifth-richest person with a net worth of $20 billion according to Forbes, has increased his shareholding in Hyderabad-based cigarettes company VST Industries, The Economic Times reported. He bought 12,000 equity shares of VST Industries during the January-March period. He decreased in logistics company Blue Dart Express in the March 2022 quarter.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: AT&T's WarnerMedia, Discovery merge, become Warner Bros Discovery
text: AT&T WarnerMedia unit and Discovery have completed their merger and the combined entity will be called Warner Bros Discovery. The new firm's portfolio includes Discovery Channel, Warner Bros Entertainment, CNN, HBO, Cartoon Network, streaming services Discovery+ and HBO Max and franchises like 'Batman' and 'Harry Potter'. It'll start trading on Monday under the ticker symbol 'WBD'.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bitcoin makes up 60% of my liquid portfolio: Mexican billionaire
text: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego at a conference revealed that Bitcoin and Bitcoin equities make up 60% of his liquid portfolio, adding the remaining 40% is in hard-asset stocks like oil and gas and gold miners. He said he doesn't have any bonds. "Bond investment is a terrible investment. I wouldn't touch a bond with a 10-foot pole," Ricardo added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: We're in a position to start testing, running pilot digital rupee projects: RBI
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is in a position to start off with testing and running pilot projects of central bank digital currency (CBDC) or digital rupee, Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar said. He added that the RBI will take a calibrated and nuanced approach towards CBDC and ensure that it is introduced in a manner that is non-disruptive.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk is now $100 billion richer than Jeff Bezos: Forbes
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now nearly $100 billion richer than Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List. Musk's net worth is now pegged at $282 billion while Bezos' net worth is at $183.6 billion. Musk, who started with a net worth of $26.6 billion in 2020, saw his wealth soar during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Chip undersupply to last until 2024: Volkswagen CFO
text: Volkswagen Chief Financial Officer Arno Antlitz has said that the supply of semiconductors is unlikely to completely meet the demands again until 2024. "The structural undersupply will likely only resolve itself in 2024," Antlitz said. He added that some issues might begin to ease towards 2022-end, with production returning to 2019 levels next year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
text: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: EV retail sales witness three-fold jump in FY22: Industry body
text: Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) said electric vehicle (EV) retail sales in India witnessed a three-fold jump YoY from 1,34,821 units sold in FY21 to 4,29,217 units sold in FY22. "Total EV sales had stood at 1,68,300 units in FY20," it further said. Tata Motors led the segment with 15,198 units sold and a market share of 85.37%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs invest ₹7,707 cr in April after 6-month-long selling streak
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net buyers between April 1-8 and invested ₹7,707 crore in Indian equities after a six-month-long selling streak. FPIs put in ₹1,403 crore in the debt markets in the period under review after pulling out net ₹8,705 crore in February and March 2022. Between October 2021 and March 2022, FPIs withdrew net ₹1.48 lakh crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cardless cash withdrawal to be available at all banks, ATMs via UPI soon: RBI
text: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "At present, the facility of cardless cash withdrawal through ATMs is limited only to a few banks." "It is now proposed to make cardless cash withdrawal facility available across all banks and ATM networks using the UPI," Das added. This would help prevent frauds such as card cloning, he stated.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 4% for the 11th time in a row
text: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Friday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and reverse repo rate at 3.35% amid geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The rates were left unchanged during the last MPC meeting in February 2022. This is the 11th consecutive time that the MPC has kept repo rate unchanged.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI cuts GDP growth projection to 7.2% for 2022-23 from 7.8% earlier
text: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das projected India's GDP growth at 7.2% in 2022-23, as against the previous projection of 7.8%. RBI expects GDP to grow at 16% in the first quarter of 2022-23, 6.2% in the second quarter, 4.1% in the third quarter and 4% in fourth quarter. Growth projections assume crude oil at $100/barrel, Das said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shark Tank India pitchers rejected by Ashneer Grover meet up, fans react
text: Shark Tank India pitchers Rohit Warrier and Niti Singhal, who were rejected by Ashneer Grover, recently met  and posted a video of their meeting on Instagram. "Weird pitches? Not so weird now!" Niti wrote in the caption. "Divided by Shark Tank united by Ashneer," a person commented while another comment read, "When two people have common enemies, they become friends."
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Japan recognises Covaxin to facilitate travel between both nations
text: Hyderabad-based Bharat Biotech informed on Friday that its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, has been recognised by Japan. "The government of Japan has included Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in the list of recognised vaccines to further facilitate travel from India to Japan starting April 10, 2022," the company tweeted. This development was also confirmed by Indian Embassy in Japan.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Covishield booster dose to be sold at discounted price of ₹600 plus tax: Poonawalla
text: Serum Institute of India will sell the precaution or booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield to private hospitals and vaccination centres at a "discounted price" of ₹600, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said. This came after the government said all adults can take the booster dose from April 10. Covishield's price has been capped at ₹780 (including taxes) at private hospitals.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Russia-Ukraine war could impede India's economic recovery: RBI Governor
text: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine "war could potentially impede the economic recovery" and projected India's real GDP growth at 7.2% for 2022-23. Das added that financial market volatility induced by monetary policy normalisation in advanced economies and renewed COVID-19 infections in some countries "pose downside risks to the outlook".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI won't do anything that goes against sanctions on Russia: Governor Das
text: During a press conference following the RBI monetary policy announcement, Governor Shaktikanta Das said that RBI "will not do anything that goes against the sanctions" on Russia. Das added, "If and when some rupee-ruble trade mechanism is worked out, you will get to know. We are sensitive to the sanctions." Earlier, India bought oil from Russia at discounted rates.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: PayPal Co-founder calls Warren Buffett a 'sociopathic grandpa' & Bitcoin's top enemy
text: At a Bitcoin conference, PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel said Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett tops an "enemies list" of people who are trying to stop the cryptocurrency. He referred to billionaire Buffett as "the sociopathic grandpa from Omaha". Thiel also said Buffett, JP Morgan's Jamie Dimon and BlackRock's Larry Fink were a "gerontocracy" opposed to a "revolutionary" crypto movement.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk wears cowboy hat, drives oldest Tesla model at company event
text: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wore a cowboy hat, and sunglasses as he drove the oldest model Tesla ever built, at Tesla's Cyber Rodeo event on Thursday. The event marked the opening of the company's Giga Texas factory near Austin. Videos from the event showed the factory plant looking like a nightclub.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zerodha CEO promises half month's pay to staff who lose weight, shares post
text: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted that employees with a BMI under 25 will get half a month's salary as a bonus. He added that while the average BMI of the team is 25.3, if it's under 24 by August, everyone will get another half a month's salary as a bonus. He also invited other companies to compete in this.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Heartening to see him grow: Ashneer shares update on Shark Tank contestant
text: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover took to Instagram to share a picture with Beyond Snack's Founder Manas. Speaking about Manas' business, Grover wrote, "Kerala Banana Chips was the first deal of Shark Tank Season 1 and it's heartening to see him grow 3x in scale profitably within 6 months!" Grover had invested in Beyond Snack.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Faith steers us through stormy seas: RBI Governor quotes Gandhi in note on economy
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das concluded his monetary policy speech by quoting Mahatma Gandhi. "It is faith that steers us through stormy seas, faith that moves mountains and faith that jumps across the ocean," he said. Earlier, he said Russia-Ukraine war poses an "overwhelming challenge" and the RBI is "prepared to defend the Indian economy with all instruments at its command".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI hikes retail inflation projection to 5.7% in 2022-23
text: While announcing the RBI monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said retail inflation is projected to be higher at 5.7% in 2022-23 amid a spike in crude oil prices due to Russia-Ukraine tensions. Retail inflation, which is measured by Consumer Price Index, is expected to be at 6.3%, 5.8%, 5.4%, and 5.1% in the first, second, third and fourth quarter, respectively.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Customer sues Burger King in US, claims Whoppers smaller than advertised
text: A customer in the US has filed a lawsuit against Burger King, accusing them of misleading customers with the size of their Whoppers. The lawsuit claimed the burger is 35% smaller than advertised. It also argued that Burger King began inflating the size of its burgers in photos around September 2017, while before it, products were advertised "more fairly".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: He came from nothing and built a world-class firm: UK FM on Narayana Murthy
text: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak praised his father-in-law and Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy and said, "He came from nothing and has created a world-class business." He added, "If I achieved a tenth of what my father-in-law achieved in his life, I'd be a happy person." Sunak's statements come amid controversy over his India-born wife Akshata Murthy's non-domicile tax status.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI imposes monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank, ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank and ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank. RBI fined Axis Bank for non-compliance with directions on loans and advances, KYC guidelines and penalties on non-maintenance of minimum balance in savings accounts. IDBI Bank was fined for reporting frauds to RBI with delay, among other things.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 3 Adani Group firms get ₹15,400 crore investment from Abu Dhabi's IHC
text: Adani Enterprises announced on Friday that Abu Dhabi-based conglomerate International Holding Company PJSC (IHC) will invest $2 billion as primary capital in three Adani Group companies. IHC will invest ₹3,850 crore in Adani Green Energy, ₹3,850 crore in Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises. The boards of the companies have approved the transaction, Adani Enterprises said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Gross tax collections surge to record ₹27.07 lakh crore in FY22
text: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that India's tax collections rose to a record high of ₹27.07 lakh crore between April 2021 and March 2022. He added that the revenue collection is almost ₹5 lakh crore above the Union Budget's estimates of ₹22.17 lakh crore. Direct tax collections in FY22 grew 49%, while indirect tax collections rose 30%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Baba Ramdev rings opening bell as Ruchi Soya FPO shares list at 30% premium
text: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Patanjali CEO Acharya Balkrishna were seen ringing the opening bell at the BSE as Ruchi Soya's follow-on public offering shares listed on Friday. The shares opened at ₹855 on NSE and at ₹850 on BSE, giving over 30% premium to subscribers who were allotted shares. Before the FPO, Ramdev-led Patanjali owned 98.9% in Ruchi Soya.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Digital Rupee won't eliminate cryptos in India: CEA Nageswaran
text: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said the introduction of a Central Bank Digital Currency, or Digital Rupee, won't lead to the elimination of cryptos and stablecoins as they satisfy different objectives. "Objective for cryptos to emerge is...tax evasion, money laundering and speculation...Therefore, they have to be tackled separately with other regulatory instruments," he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk's Twitter investment is tiny, meaningless: Tesla shareholder
text: One of Tesla's largest shareholders Ron Baron, CEO of Baron Capital, said Tesla CEO Elon Musk's stake in Twitter and his accompanying board seat are not significant. "I think it's meaningless. It's a tiny investment...He has Tesla which is worth a trillion [and] on the way to being worth $3 or $4 trillion," Baron added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: We're not aware of it: NPCI as Coinbase says users can buy crypto with UPI
text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has clarified it's not aware of any crypto exchange using UPI after US-based Coinbase said it will allow users to buy cryptocurrencies with UPI. Coinbase later said that it was aware of the recent statement published by NPCI. "We are committed to working with NPCI and other relevant authorities," the crypto exchange said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mahindra's deal to sell SsangYong to S Korea's Edison terminated
text: Mahindra & Mahindra's deal to sell its subsidiary SsangYong Motor to South Korean electric carmaker Edison Motors has been terminated. Edison's inability to deposit the bid amount led to the termination of the deal, Mahindra said in an exchange filing. Mahindra owned about 75% of SsangYong as of September-end 2021, which it bought in 2010.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: BIAL, Amazon Web Services to collaborate for innovation centre at B'luru airport
text: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) is working with Amazon Web Services (AWS), to establish a Joint Innovation Centre (JIC) at Kempegowda International Airport to drive the development and adoption of digital solutions in aviation. "This is the first JIC by AWS established outside China and its first JIC dedicated to advancing the aviation industry," BIAL said in a statement.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Price of lemons increases to ₹10 each in Hyd; vendors say 'nobody buying'
text: Amid rising lemon prices across the country over the past week, the price of lemons has increased to ₹10 each in Hyderabad. "Earlier, we used to purchase a whole lemon sack for ₹700, which now costs ₹3,500," a vegetable vendor said. "I bought a dozen of lemons for ₹120. Earlier, I used to purchase them for ₹20," a customer said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Whistleblower alleges wrongdoing at Invesco Mutual Fund: Reports
text: A whistleblower has filed complaints with SEBI and US SEC about alleged mismanagement by Invesco Mutual Fund's fixed income team, Moneycontrol reported. Invesco is accused of having the same person holding the positions of Chief Investment Officer and Advisor to its offshore portfolio management services. The fixed income team is accused of executing trades on behalf of Invesco's offshore funds.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Group becomes 3rd Indian group to cross $200 billion in market value
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has become India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion. On Thursday, the group's market value stood at $201 billion as the shares of five of its seven listed firms hit all-time highs, according to BSE data. Earlier, Tata Group ($320 billion) and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Group ($237 billion) achieved this milestone.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Gautam Adani becomes world's 6th richest person: Forbes
text: India's richest man and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has become the world's sixth richest person with a net worth of $116.6 billion, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. He surpassed Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison and Google's Founders Sergey Brin and Larry Page to reach the spot. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries' Chairman remained the world's 10th richest person, as per Forbes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No pressure on India over trade with Russia: MEA
text: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), when asked about western pressure over trade with Russia, said, "Don't think there's any such pressure. Talks of sanctions going on but it's not on the entire trade." The MEA added, "Our focus is to maintain and stabilise our established economic relations with Russia."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: News article calls Musk's Twitter stake 'bad news' for free speech, he laughs
text: World's richest person Elon Musk laughed in response to a Washington Post article that said his Twitter stake is "bad news" for free speech. "WaPo always good for a laugh," Musk said. Pointing to Musk's stake, Amazon's Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post had written, "When you're the world's richest human you can toss billions around like poker chips."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Meta employees 'lovingly' call me 'The Eye of Sauron': Mark Zuckerberg
text: During an appearance on The Tim Ferriss Show, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "Some of the folks I work with at the company, they say this lovingly, but I think that they sometimes refer to my attention as the Eye of Sauron." Zuckerberg was referring to the Lord of the Rings villain usually depicted as a flaming eye.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Edtech unicorn Unacademy lays off 1,000 employees: Report
text: Bengaluru-based edtech unicorn Unacademy has laid off around 1,000 employees in the past few weeks as part of a cost-cutting exercise, ET reported citing sources. An Unacademy spokesperson said, "A small subset of employee, contractor and educator roles were re-evaluated due to role redundancy and performance." Unacademy was last valued at $3.4 billion in a funding round in August 2021.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Lemon prices touch ₹400 per kg in Rajasthan's Jaipur
text: Lemon prices have increased in several parts of the country amid soaring temperatures and touched ₹400 per kilogram in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Wednesday. On Tuesday, lemons were selling for ₹340 per kilogram in Jaipur. Traders at local mandis said vegetable prices soar during the summers, but an increase in the prices of fuel is triggering the price rise of produce.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: In which states do India's richest real estate developers live as per Hurun?
text: According to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021, Maharashtra is the preferred state for India's richest developers with 37 individuals residing there. Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family are the richest developers in the state. Maharashtra is followed by Delhi (23), Karnataka (20), Telangana (6) and Gujarat (4). DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest real estate developer.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Anand Mahindra shares video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to social media to share a video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest. "Sometimes, when you have to make hard decisions, it helps to imagine you're on top of Everest with an unobstructed view of the world. Becomes easier to see the 'big picture'," he wrote.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Russian women film themselves cutting Chanel bags as brand stops selling to them
text: Several wealthy Russian women and influencers have been filming themselves cutting their Chanel bags with a pair of scissors after the brand pulled out of Russia and stopped selling to Russians abroad. "I am against Russophobia...If owning Chanel means selling my Motherland, then I don't need Chanel," TV presenter and actress Marina Ermoshkina said, cutting her bag.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's ruble surges to the level it was before Putin invaded Ukraine
text: Russia's ruble has surged back to the levels where it was before President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine, trading at 74.2625 per dollar in early Moscow trade on Thursday. This comes as foreign countries continue to buy Russian oil and natural gas, supporting the ruble. International sanctions had earlier sunk the ruble to a record low of 121.5 rubles per dollar.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Which countries have the most number of billionaires as per Forbes?
text: According to Forbes' World's Billionaires 2022 list, the US has the most number of billionaires at 735. This is followed by 539 in China, a drop from 626 last year. India is ranked third with 166 billionaires, followed by 134 in Germany, 83 in Russia, 67 in Hong Kong, 64 in Canada, 62 in Brazil and 52 in Italy.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: May face impairment losses of up to $5 bn due to Russia exit: Shell
text: Oil and natural gas giant Shell is writing off $4 billion to $5 billion in assets after it pulled its operations in Russia. On March 8, Shell announced that it would exit the Russian oil and natural gas sector and close all its service stations in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. "These charges are expected to be identified," Shell said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia: Govt
text: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday said India is trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia, a day after India condemned killings of civilians in Ukraine. Jaishankar added that India has chosen the "side of peace" in the Russia-Ukraine war. Russia is India's main supplier of defence hardware but the overall annual trade between the two countries is small.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk denies selling Twitter shares, says 'initial number was incorrect'
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has refuted reports claiming he had reduced his stake in Twitter from 9.2% to 9.1%. "No sale took place. Initial share number filed was incorrect," he said in response to a claim that he had sold 371,900 Twitter shares. A filing on Tuesday showed that the Tesla CEO had taken a 9.1% stake in Twitter.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals 11.4% stake in HP worth $4.2 bn
text: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed its purchase of nearly 121 million shares of HP, giving it a roughly 11.4% stake worth about $4.2 billion. HP shares jumped nearly 10% to $38.38 in after-hours trading after Berkshire disclosed the stake in SEC filings. In March, Berkshire agreed to buy insurance company Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: SC orders resumption of arbitration over ₹24,713-cr Future-Reliance deal
text: The Supreme Court has ordered Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) to resume its arbitral proceedings in ₹24,713-crore Future Retail's merger deal with Reliance. Both Future Group and Amazon have consented to the resumption of arbitral proceedings before the SIAC. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had stayed arbitration proceedings between the two parties in January.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Flipkart planning US listing in 2023 at $60-70 bn valuation: Report
text: Flipkart has pushed its IPO valuation target to around $60-70 billion, and is now planning a US listing in 2023 instead of 2022, Reuters reported citing sources. Some sources reportedly said that the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine played a part in Flipkart delaying its plans. Others said Flipkart's internal plan to boost valuations further caused the delay.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Maruti Suzuki to recall 19,731 EECO cars to rectify wheel size marking
text: India's largest car manufacturer Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it'll voluntarily recall 19,731 units of its EECO model to inspect and rectify incorrect marking of wheel size. The incorrect marking has been found in units manufactured between July 19, 2021 and October 5, 2021. "The issue has no implication on performance, safety or environment," the carmaker said in a statement.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Karnataka CM to inaugurate 'SARAS' fair in Bengaluru tomorrow
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate 'Sanjeevini SARAS-2022', a national fair of Self-Help Group women on Friday in Bengaluru, State Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said. About 700 women entrepreneurs from across the country will participate in the fair to showcase their skills and sell the products, which include handlooms, handicrafts, etc. About 310 stalls will be on display at the fair.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Coca-Cola to set up 2nd plant worth ₹1,000 cr in Telangana
text: Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages on Thursday signed a partnership with the Telangana government and announced a fresh investment of ₹1,000 crore for setting up their second factory in the state. Coca-Cola will initially invest ₹600 crore in the new facility and add another ₹400 crore over the next five years, reports said. The facility will manufacture packaged beverages, juices and more.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Greater Noida increases land rates up to 25% in residential category
text: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) has increased the land allotment rates up to 25% which is between ₹5,000-₹7,000 per square metre for residential plots for FY 2022-23. The new rates per square metre of land will be ₹39,000 for category A, ₹36,000 for category B, ₹34,000 for category C and ₹29,000 for category D, the GNIDA said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: CCI probes SBI, Axis & IDBI Bank on suspected fee cartel: Reports
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) is investigating the trustee units of State Bank of India, Axis Bank and IDBI Bank for suspected collusion of fees, Reuters reported. Last year, Trustees Association of India (TAI) "substantially" increased the fee for assisting companies raising debt, thereby hurting competition, CCI stated in an order. TAI has challenged the probe and called it "illegal".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BankBazaar plans IPO in 2023; seeks to hire 1,500 employees
text: Online financial services marketplace BankBazaar plans to list an IPO in 2023, the company said on Thursday. After reporting revenue growth in FY22, the Sequoia India and Amazon-backed firm also plans to recruit over 1,500 employees across departments this year aiming to expand its product offerings. BankBazaar reported annualised revenue run rate of ₹156 crore, the company added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ADB expects India's FY23 GDP to grow at 7.5%, inflation at 5.8%
text: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has pegged India's GDP growth projection for FY23 at 7.5%. ADB added that India's economic growth in the coming years will be supported by increased public investment in infrastructure and a pickup in private investment. Inflation in India is likely to increase to 5.8% in FY23 amid rising oil prices, ADB said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Exploring all options to procure affordable crude oil: Govt
text: Centre is exploring all viable options to procure crude oil at affordable rates, the Finance Ministry said. Rise in imports in March because of an increase in oil prices "doesn't portend well for the economy in the year ahead", the Ministry added. If fuel was available at a discount, India would buy it, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had said earlier.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ATS group firm goes into insolvency; may affect homebuyers of Gurugram project
text: Insolvency proceedings have been initiated against ATS group firm Anand Divine Developers after ICICI Prudential Venture filed a petition for non-payment of dues worth ₹25 crore. Over 443 homebuyers of the ATS Triumph project in Gurugram's Sector 104 will likely be impacted. PSP Legal's partner Piyush Singh, who is representing the project's buyers, said homebuyers must file claims immediately.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 14th time in 16 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 14th time in 16 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹105.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹96.67/litre from ₹95.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹120.51/litre from ₹119.67/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹104.77/litre from ₹103.92/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who are the top 10 shareholders of Twitter?
text: The world's richest person Elon Musk is the largest shareholder of Twitter, owning a 9.2% stake in the platform. Vanguard Group is the second-largest shareholder, with an 8.4% stake, followed by Morgan Stanley Investment Management (8.1%), BlackRock (4.6%) and SSgA Funds Management (4.5%), according to FactSet. Aristotle Capital holds a 2.5% stake and Co-founder Jack Dorsey holds a 2.3% stake.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk to join Twitter's board of directors
text: Twitter is appointing the world's richest person Elon Musk to its board of directors after he disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in the company. "He's both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on Twitter, and in the boardroom," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who are India's richest real estate developers & what are their net worths?
text: DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest developer with a wealth of ₹61,220 crore, according to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021. He has overtaken Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family, who now rank 2nd, with ₹52,970 crore wealth. K Raheja's Chandru Raheja & family ranked 3rd with ₹26,290 crore. Embassy Office Parks' Jitendra Virwani ranked 4th.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are India's 10 richest people according to Forbes' latest rich list?
text: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person with $90.7 billion wealth as of March 11, Forbes' latest rich list released on Tuesday stated. Gautam Adani is second-richest in India with $90 billion wealth, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar ($28.7 billion) and Cyrus Poonawalla ($24.3 billion). DMart's Radhakishan Damani is fifth-richest in India with $20 billion wealth and Lakshmi Mittal sixth-richest.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: EU bans Russian coal imports worth €4 bn per yr in 5th sanctions package amid war
text: The European Union on Tuesday said it would ban the import of coal from Russia that's worth €4 billion per year, in its fifth sanctions package over the Ukraine war. It also imposed a full transaction ban on four key Russian banks, including Russia's second-largest bank VTB. Russian and Russia-operated vessels have also been banned from accessing EU ports.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I'm really happy Elon is joining the Twitter board: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
text: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey on Tuesday tweeted, "I'm really happy Elon Musk is joining the Twitter board!" Dorsey added, "He cares deeply about our world and Twitter's role in it. Parag Agrawal (Twitter's CEO) and Elon both lead with their hearts, and they will be an incredible team." Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder with a 9.2% stake.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk can't own over 14.9% stake in Twitter as its board member
text: Elon Musk cannot own more than 14.9% of Twitter's common stock as long as he is on the company's board of directors, according to a filing with the US' Securities and Exchange Commission. Musk, who's the world's richest person, was appointed to Twitter's board on Tuesday. He currently holds a stake of 9.2% in Twitter, making him the largest shareholder.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk refiles Twitter stake disclosure to show he's an active investor
text: World's richest person Elon Musk refiled the disclosure of his stake in Twitter to classify himself as an active investor, after he was appointed to the company's board. Earlier, he had filed a disclosure showing a passive stake of over 9% in Twitter, meaning he wouldn't seek change at the company. His stake ownership makes him Twitter's largest shareholder.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Looking forward to working with Twitter CEO Parag: Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, who is joining Twitter's board of directors, on Tuesday tweeted, "Looking forward to working with Parag & Twitter board to make significant improvements to Twitter in coming months!" Twitter's CEO Parag Agrawal welcomed Musk to Twitter's board by saying, "He would bring great value to our Board."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: It's just an employee going slightly bonkers: CEO Suhail on BharatPe-Ashneer row
text: Speaking about the BharatPe-Ashneer Grover row, CEO Suhail Sameer told Moneycontrol, "Whatever happened was basically an employee going slightly bonkers, which...happens in a lot of companies." On the outcome of audits by Alvarez & Marsal and PwC, Suhail said, "It is not as controversial as everyone thought." Ashneer and his wife Madhuri were accused of misappropriation of funds.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ex-TCS staff turns part-time Zomato delivery agent, shares post on his challenges
text: A former TCS employee, Srinivasan Jayaraman's post on challenges he faced as a part-time Zomato delivery agent is being widely circulated. Jayaraman wrote about the inaccuracy of delivery locations of customers and restaurants. He said often phone numbers aren't properly updated and there were cases of long-distance delivery locations. "I salute those who choose this as a career," he said.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I did what is right for company: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer on Grover's exit
text: Speaking about Ashneer Grover’s exit, BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer said he did what was right for the company. While mentioning that he and Grover were friends, he said, "We were like very very close…But my job here isn't to be a great friend. My job is to do what's right." Sameer added, "I won't let anything come on my reputation."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Paytm says it will break even operationally in 1.5 years, shares jump
text: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications jumped over 6% during intraday trade on Wednesday after the company said it expects to break even on an operational basis over the next year-and-a-half. "We are going to achieve this without compromising any of our growth plans," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said. The company's shares have fallen around 70% below its IPO price.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm CEO's stock options to vest only when its market cap crosses IPO level
text: In a letter to shareholders, Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said, "My stock grants will be vested to me only when our market cap has crossed...IPO level on a sustained basis." The stock is down "significantly" due to "volatile market conditions", he added. Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares had fallen over 70% below its IPO price since its November listing.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Fuel price hike in India is 1/10th of price hike in other countries: HS Puri
text: Fuel prices hike in India is one-tenth of the price hike in other countries, Petroleum Minister HS Puri said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Comparing gasoline (petrol) prices between April 2021 and March 2022, the prices in the US have increased by 51%, Canada 52%, Germany 55%, UK 55%, France 50%, Spain 58% but in India 5%," said Puri.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Haldiram's trends as video shows reporter questioning staff over 'Urdu' text on packets
text: Indian multinational sweets, snacks and restaurant company Haldiram's is trending on social media after a video showed a TV reporter questioning the staff of an outlet over alleged Urdu text on namkeen packets. "You can do whatever ma'am, Haldiram's won't entertain such tantrums," an employee was seen telling the reporter. Some social media users suggested the text was in Arabic.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US isn't seeking a 'divorce' from China: US trade chief
text: The US is seeking to realign its commercial ties with China in line with its policies focused on "realignment in the global economy", rather than seek a "divorce", Katherine Tai, the US Trade Representative, said. "I'd focus really on the kinds of changes that we're trying to bring, which are really not about stopping trade or trade divorce," she added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: At 24, I went to US with my broken English, home food to chase my dream: Agarwal
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal said he left for the US when he was 24 to expand his cable business and buy second-hand equipment. "With my tooti-footi (broken) English, a suitcase filled with ghar ka khana and a...friend from Bihar...I took off to chase my dream," he recalled. He stitched $500 to his coat's inside due to fear of pickpockets.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Starbucks announces plans to get into NFT business
text: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz has announced the firms' plans to get into the non-fungible-token (NFT) business. It's working on "digital innovation through NFTs" and expects to unveil details soon. "If you look at the companies, the brands...that are trying to create a...NFT...business, I can't find one of them that has the treasure trove of assets that Starbucks has," Schultz said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Getting rid of spam higher priority: Binance CEO on Musk's Twitter poll
text: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao in response to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter edit button poll said, "Getting rid of spam is probably [a] higher priority. Protect users." Earlier, Musk had posted a poll asking his followers if they wanted an edit button. Last year, Zhao and Musk argued on Twitter after Musk called Binance's handling of its Dogecoin glitch "shady".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: US-based Triton to set up ₹10,800 cr EV manufacturing plant in Gujarat
text: Triton EV has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government to set up a ₹10,800 crore electric commercial vehicle production plant in Kutch. Initially, ₹1,200 crore will be invested by the company during FY23 for setting up the facility on a 645 acre plot in Bhuj. The unit will have annual production capacity of 50,000 trucks.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reduce import duty on newsprint: Sushil Modi tells Centre
text: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi urged the Centre to reduce import duty on newsprint to help revive the newspaper industry, which is impacted due to supply shortages of newsprint amid Russia-Ukraine crisis. "India is extremely reliant on newsprint import and is the largest importer of newsprint globally, importing 45% from Russia alone," he said. "Newspapers...are essential for democracy," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
text: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Individuals can use UPI for public issue payments of up to ₹5 lakh
text: SEBI on Tuesday said individual investors applying in public issues of equity shares can use UPI for application amount of up to ₹5 lakh from May 1 onwards. Investors have also been asked to provide their UPI ID in the bid-cum-application form. National Payments Corporation of India had increased per transaction limit in UPI to ₹5 lakh in December 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Milk prices to stay firm, can only go up from here: Amul MD
text: Milk prices will remain firm and can only increase from their current rates, Amul MD RS Sodhi said. Inflation in the milk industry isn't a concern as farmers' profits have increased due to hike in prices, he added. Amul is not affected by increased pressure from energy, logistics and packaging costs as profit-making is not Amul's core objective, Sodhi said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ruchi Soya shares fall 19% after ₹4,300-cr FPO allotment announcement
text: Ruchi Soya shares fell over 19% during the early trading hours on Wednesday as its board cleared the allotment of 6.61 crore equity shares via a follow-on public offer (FPO) to raise ₹4,300 crore. The company fixed the issue price at ₹650 per share. The firm had received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an FPO in August last year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: CRED announces first few winners of CRED bounty
text: CRED announced that with CRED bounty, members can buzz friends and win big this IPL season. Deepak Gupta won Apple package, including iPhone, MacBook, AirPods, and more, CRED revealed, adding that Amit Ghosh won Greece cruise trip and Diwanshu Gaur, Azhar Saifi and Sachin Sharma won Tanishq jewellery worth ₹2 lakh, Amazon vouchers worth ₹2 lakh, and Sony package respectively.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Dearness Allowance for Karnataka govt employees hiked by 2.75% to 27.25%
text: The Karnataka government on Tuesday announced a 2.75% hike in the Dearness Allowance (DA) payable to its employees in the revised 2018 pay scales and under the seventh pay commission. Employees will now get 27.25% DA with effect from January 1 this year. This comes days after PM Narendra Modi approved a 3% hike in DA for central government employees.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Oh hi lol: Elon Musk's first tweet after his 9.2% stake in Twitter disclosed
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Oh hi lol," after his 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday. According to a regulatory filing, Musk, who has emerged as the biggest shareholder of Twitter, purchased the stake on March 14. Following the news, the shares of Twitter jumped as much as 26%, the most since 2018.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who were the top corporate donors to national parties in 2019-20 as per ADR?
text: Prudent Electoral Trust was the top donor to two national parties - BJP and INC - in FY 2019-20, according to a report by NGO ADR on Monday. The Trust donated 38 times in a single year to the two parties each, amounting to a total of ₹247.75 crore. Janakalyan Electoral Trust was the second-largest corporate donor, followed by ITC.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 13th time in 15 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for 13th time in 15 days. Petrol in Delhi will now cost ₹104.61 per litre as against ₹103.81 previously, while diesel rates have gone up from ₹95.07 per litre to ₹95.87, according to a price notification of state fuel retailers. In Mumbai, petrol now costs ₹119.67/litre, while diesel costs ₹103.92 per litre.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: IndiGo Co-founder, who graduated from IIT Kanpur, gives ₹100 cr to the college
text: IndiGo airline's Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, who did his B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kanpur in 1975, has donated ₹100 crore to the college. The contribution is focused on supporting the School of Medical Sciences & Technology at IIT Kanpur. Indian-American businessman Rakesh Gangwal, his wife and their daughter were present in person for the agreement signing in Mumbai.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt having discussion, should announce booster dose policy soon: Adar Poonawalla
text: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said, "We have appealed to the government (for a policy on booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines) as everyone who needs to travel needs to take the booster dose." He added, "They're having an internal discussion and should announce very soon in next few days on the booster policy."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bill Gates shares old video of himself jumping over chair as Microsoft turns 47
text: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, took to Instagram to share an old video of himself jumping over a chair to celebrate 47 years of Microsoft's existence. "It took leaps and bounds to accomplish Microsoft's vision of a computer on every desk and in every home," wrote Gates. Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk starts poll on edit button, Twitter CEO Parag says 'Please vote carefully'
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a Twitter poll asking users if they want the microblogging platform to have an edit button. Responding to the poll, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said, "The consequences of this poll will be important. Please vote carefully." Earlier, Musk asked users if they believed Twitter rigorously adhered to the principle of free speech.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: All practices in compliance with law: Zomato after CCI orders probe
text: Zomato issued a statement after the Competition Commission of India ordered an investigation into the conduct of Swiggy and Zomato. It said while CCI has prima facie didn't find concerns with respect to their independence on levy of commissions or alleged bundling of services, it'll work to assist them and explain why their services are in compliance with the law.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I've never traded stocks, I don't even have a brokerage account: Zoho CEO
text: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told Moneycontrol, "I have never actually traded. In fact, I don't even have a brokerage account." Stockbroking startup Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath, who was also a part of the conversation, was asked if he would make a pitch to add Vembu on Zerodha. "I don't think Sridhar has to invest in the markets," Kamath replied.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zomato shares decline after CCI orders probe
text: Shares of Zomato fell up to 5% on Tuesday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered an investigation into the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy. Zomato said it will assist the CCI in their investigation into the preferential listing of restaurant partners and pricing parity across platforms. Zomato shares later pared losses and were trading 2.61% lower on NSE.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: How much are petrol and diesel prices expected to further rise according to experts?
text: Experts have noted that retail prices of petrol and diesel need to be hiked by ₹0.52-0.60 for every $1/barrel rise in the price of crude oil for oil marketing companies. The price of Brent crude has risen by about $28.4/barrel since November 4 to $108.9/barrel, indicating that fuel prices could see further hikes of ₹5.5-7.8/litre each on petrol and diesel.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Boss in UK pays 60 employees over ₹74,000 each to help them pay bills
text: A boss in the UK paid 60 of his workers £750 (over ₹74,000) each to help them pay their bills amid rising living costs in the country. The 51-year-old MD of Emerys Timber and Builders Merchants said he wanted to "share back the success of the business". UK energy regulator Ofgem has announced a hike in the energy price cap.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Investors get ₹4.5 lakh crore richer as Sensex rallies over HDFC merger
text: Investors turned richer by over ₹4.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex ended 1,335 points higher at 60,612, primarily led by the merger announcement of HDFC and HDFC Bank. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, rose to around ₹272.46 lakh crore. Investors of HDFC group companies gained over 1 lakh crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elephants can dance as well: HDFC Bank's CEO on merger with HDFC
text: HDFC Bank's CEO Sashidhar Jagdishan, who will lead the merged entity of HDFC Bank and HDFC, said, "Elephants can dance as well." When asked about the next milestone, Jagdishan said, "We don't work for any milestones." He added, "Even if I'm not there...this engine created by the founding fathers...it's such a fantastic platform that it will grow on its own."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: FIIs & FPIs may come and go, retail investors take care of markets: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that retail investors have brought a shock-absorbing capacity into the Indian markets. "FIIs and FPIs may come and go but today the Indian retail investors have proven that any shock that may come in is now taken care of," she added. Sitharaman further informed Lok Sabha that the inflow of FDI remains unabated.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Crypto payments worth ₹2.2 cr made in 11 drug trafficking cases: Govt
text: Narcotics Control Bureau and Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs have unearthed crypto payments worth ₹2.2 crore in 11 drug trafficking cases, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. Government is taking steps to check such usage, he added. Liaisoning with technical experts and coordination with foreign drug law enforcement agencies is being done regularly, Chaudhary said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Musk is sending strong signal to Twitter CEO Agrawal: Cathie Wood
text: ARK Invest's Cathie Wood said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "sending a strong signal" to the new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, after Musk's 9.2% Twitter stake was revealed. She added Musk is making a statement about censorship and that Musk doesn't believe in it. Wood also discussed that the news could also be "setting up for another leadership change".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Paytm Payments Bank yet to appoint firm for IT audit: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said Paytm Payments Bank hasn't yet appointed a firm to conduct an audit of its IT systems. On March 11, RBI barred the bank from onboarding new customers and ordered it to appoint an audit firm. Order followed a report that the bank allegedly leaked data to Chinese entities, Bloomberg reported citing sources.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Amazon, Future Retail agree in Supreme Court to appear before SIAC
text: Amazon and Future Retail (FRL) expressed their agreement before the Supreme Court on Monday to appear before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) over FRL's deal with Reliance Retail. Amazon and FRL are involved in legal fight over FRL's ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance. The Supreme Court told the companies that it will request the arbitration tribunal to expedite the proceedings.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IndiGo suspends few pilots, they reportedly planned protest over pay cuts
text: Some IndiGo pilots were suspended for planning a mass leave on Tuesday to protest against pay cuts, reports said. IndiGo pilots' salaries were cut by as much as 30% during the COVID-19 pandemic's peak. "We confirm that a handful of IndiGo pilots have been suspended...for indulging in activities that are in contravention to the terms of their employment," IndiGo said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
text: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Will protect interest of Supertech twin towers' homebuyers: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will protect the interest of homebuyers of Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in its Emerald Court project. The Supreme Court noted submissions of senior advocate S Ganesh, appearing for Supertech's ex-management, that of the 711 homebuyers, claims of 652 homebuyers had been settled. The remaining homebuyers need to be refunded ₹14.96 crore in total.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We must have a common culture post-merger: HDFC Chairman
text: HDFC and HDFC Bank "will have to have a common culture" after the merger, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Tuesday. "Now, bank will have to deal in housing loans which is very emotional, personal...So we have to be very careful with all our customers," he added. As per the announcement, HDFC will acquire a 41% stake in HDFC Bank.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's trade deficit rises by 87.5% to $192 billion in 2021-22
text: India's trade deficit rose by 87.5% from $102.63 billion in 2020-21 to $192.41 billion in 2021-22, government data showed on Monday. While total exports in FY22 rose to a record high of $417.81 billion, imports too soared 54.71% year-on-year to $610.22 billion on the back of rising global fuel and commodity prices. Merchandise imports in FY21 stood at $394.44 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Banks force you to travel to the home branch for everything: Jupiter
text: People face a lot of trouble due to the rules of some banks, said Jupiter, a 100%* digital banking app, adding that people have to take leaves from work or they end up wasting their weekend just doing bank work. Tired of such routines, Jupiter promises to be a banking partner for millennials and offers a 100%* digital banking experience.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹64.11 per kg
text: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Monday. CNG will now cost ₹64.11 per kg in the national capital. "In view of the CNG price hike, we are not in favour of switching on the cab's air conditioner for passengers," a city-based cab driver told ANI.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: HDFC board approves merger of company with HDFC Bank
text: The board of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) has approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank. "[It]...shall enable HDFC Bank to build its housing loan portfolio and enhance its existing customer base," HDFC said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Elon Musk discloses 9.2% stake in Twitter
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in Twitter, Bloomberg reported citing a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. Following the news, shares of the social media platform jumped more than 25% in pre-market trading in the US. Musk's stake is worth around $2.89 billion, based on Twitter's closing price on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's exports touch record high of $417.8 bn in FY22, govt calls it 'historic'
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday announced that India's exports touched a record high of $417.8 billion in FY22, and called the milestone "historic". "It's the first time that the country's yearly exports have reached this figure and the exports were 5% above the set target," Goyal said. Goods worth $40 billion were exported in March 2022 alone.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 12th time in 14 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 12th time in 14 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.81/litre after being increased by 40 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹95.07/litre from ₹94.67/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.83/litre from ₹118.41/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹103.07/litre from ₹102.64/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: HDFC Bank-HDFC merger may create India's 2nd-largest company, beating TCS
text: HDFC and HDFC Bank saw their combined market capitalisation surpass that of India's second-most valued company, TCS, on Monday. Following the announcement that HDFC will merge itself with HDFC Bank, both stocks surged over 9% each during intraday trade. At closing, HDFC Bank's market value stood at ₹9.18 lakh crore, while HDFC's market cap was at ₹4.84 lakh crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk becomes Twitter's largest shareholder with 9.2% stake
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has become the largest shareholder of Twitter after he disclosed that he owns a 9.2% passive stake in the platform. It's more than quadruple the 2.25% stake held by Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey. Notably, Musk conducted a Twitter poll last month asking users whether Twitter adheres to the principle of free speech.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 30-yr-old crypto billionaire drives Corolla, sleeps on bean bag & has 10 roommates
text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, "lives like a college student", sleeps on a bean bag and drives a Toyota Corolla, Bloomberg reported. "When he's not at the office, he crashes at an apartment with 10 roommates, though it's a penthouse," Bloomberg added. Sam, worth over $20 billion, is currently living in the Bahamas.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'll keep only 1% of my earnings: FTX's 30-yr-old crypto billionaire worth $20 bn
text: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, told Bloomberg that he'll "keep enough money to maintain a comfortable life: 1% of his earnings or, at minimum, $100,000 a year." Bloomberg added, "Other than that, he plans to give it all away—every dollar, or Bitcoin." Sam Bankman-Fried has a net worth of over $20 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $71 billion wiped out of market cap of Singapore's Grab and Sea in 3 months
text: Singapore's two largest new-economy companies have lost a combined $71 billion from their market capitalisation this year. While shares of ride-hailing company Grab have more than halved in the last three months, technology giant Sea's stock price has plunged by 46%. Sea-owned Shopee recently shut down India operations, whereas its Free Fire game was banned by the Indian government.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bezos shares pic of Amazon's office from early days, says 'Big things start small'
text: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture of his office from Amazon's early days, and wrote, "Big things start small." The office had 'amazon.com' spray-painted on a banner and a table built out of a wooden door. He also shared a video of his company Blue Origin's fourth spaceflight with astronauts aboard.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rahul shares chart comparing cost of full tank of fuel in vehicles in 2014 & now
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a chart comparing the cost of a full tank of fuel in different vehicles in 2014 and now. According to him, it costed ₹714 for a full tank of fuel in a bike, compared to ₹1,038 now. It costed ₹2,856 for a full tank of fuel in car in 2014, compared to ₹4,152 now.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Shein's valuation would top H&M and Zara combined with $1 billion funding
text: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is in talks to raise $1 billion and could do so at a valuation that would be more than the combined worth of H&M and Zara. Shein is seeking a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported. Following the funding, Shein would become the world’s most-valuable startup after ByteDance and SpaceX, as per CB Insights.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: COVID-19 medicines sold at 5% GST, others at 5-12%: MoS Finance
text: Pankaj Chaudhary, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Finance, on Monday said that COVID-19 medicines and instruments are being sold at a GST rate of 5%. Other medicines have been sold at a GST rate between 5-12% since the pandemic started, he added. He said the GST rate for health insurance is 18%, which is as per international standards.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Economic crisis makes Sri Lankan stocks world's worst performers after Russia
text: Amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis, the country's stocks have fallen about 33% in 2022, making them the world's worst performers after Russian equities. In 2021, the Sri Lanka Colombo Stock Exchange had rallied 80%, posting the world's best performance after Mongolia. On Monday, the central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal resigned amid soaring inflation and fuel shortage.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I can't be on board of merged bank, I've crossed 75 yrs of age: HDFC Chairman
text: HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Monday that he will not be on the board of the merged entity, once HDFC combines with HDFC Bank. "The RBI does not allow anyone above the age of 75 years to be on the board of a bank. I have already crossed that age," the 77-year-old said. Parekh had joined HDFC in 1978.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex ends 1,335 points higher at 60,612, HDFC & HDFC Bank gain 9% each
text: The Sensex jumped 1,335 points to end at 60,612 on Monday, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 383 points to end at 18,053. HDFC and HDFC Bank, which surged over 9% each following their merger announcement, were the top Sensex gainers. With Sensex reclaiming 60,000-mark on Monday, investors' wealth has increased by ₹30 lakh crore in nearly a month.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I spent two sleepless nights ahead of HDFC-HDFC Bank merger: Chairman
text: After announcing the merger of HDFC with HDFC Bank, Chairman Deepak Parekh said he spent "two sleepless nights" prior to the development. "After 45 years of housing finance and 9 million homes provided to Indians, we had to find a home for ourselves. We have found it within our own family and in our own bank," Parekh further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HDFC-HDFC Bank combined entity will be among world's 100 most-valued firms
text: The combined entity formed out of the HDFC Bank-HDFC merger will be among the world's 100 most-valued firms in terms of market capitalisation, as per Bloomberg data. The entity will likely be worth $190 billion (over ₹14 lakh crore), making it the 63rd most-valued company globally. Currently, Apple is the world's most-valued company with a market value of $2.84 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: As son grows older, he acquires father's business: Parekh on HDFC-HDFC Bank merger
text: After HDFC announced that it'll merge itself with HDFC Bank, its Chairman Deepak Parekh said, "It's a merger of equals. It's a friendly...not at all hostile. And, we are one." "As the son grows old, he acquires the father's business...That's all happening here, nothing more," Parekh added. HDFC was founded in 1977, while HDFC Bank was set up in 1994.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nepal becomes 4th country to launch India's e-payment system RuPay
text: Nepal on Saturday became the fourth country in the world to operationalise India's e-payment system RuPay. The three other countries that have the RuPay card are Bhutan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates. The Indian External Affairs Ministry said the launch of the card in Nepal would open new vistas for cooperation in financial connectivity and further strengthen people-to-people linkages.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Pune diesel prices rise to ₹100.60 per litre after 11th hike in 13 days
text: The diesel prices in Pune crossed the ₹100 per litre mark on Sunday after the 11th hike in prices in 13 days. The diesel in the city now costs ₹100.60 per litre, a rise of 83 paise from April 2, while petrol costs ₹117.87 per litre. The diesel price in Mumbai has been increased to ₹102.64 per litre from ₹101.79/litre.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Unemployment rate dropping in India, fell to 7.6% in March: CMIE
text: India's unemployment rate is decreasing and fell to 7.6% in March 2022, the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy's (CMIE) data showed. The unemployment ratio further dropped to 7.5% on April 2, with urban unemployment at 8.5% and rural at 7.1%. Haryana recorded the highest unemployment rate in March at 26.7%, while Gujarat and Karnataka recorded the lowest at 1.8%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Over ₹53,000 crore owed to states as FY22's GST compensation: Govt
text: The central government still owes ₹53,489 crore to states and UTs in GST compensation for the period between April 2021 and January 2022, the Finance Ministry said on Monday. Of this, the maximum amount is owed to Maharashtra at ₹11,563 crore. The Centre borrowed ₹1.59 lakh crore in FY22 to make up for the shortfall in GST compensation cess collections.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs withdraw ₹41,000 cr in Mar, become net sellers for 6th month
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹41,123 crore from the Indian equity market in March 2022. With this, FPIs became net sellers for the sixth consecutive month, having withdrawn net ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022. Apart from equities, the debt segment witnessed net outflows of ₹5,632 crore in March.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India continues to remain highest receiver of FDI: FM Sitharaman
text: India has been the highest receiver of foreign direct investment (FDI) since before COVID-19 and continues to be so even now, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that Indian retail investors have created the capacity to absorb shocks due to outflow of foreign funds. Earlier, data showed that foreign portfolio investors withdrew ₹1.48 lakh crore from October 2021-March 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: For ₹1,400 crore, Amazon destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company: Future Retail
text: Future Retail told the Supreme Court that "for ₹1,400 crore, Amazon has destroyed a ₹26,000-crore company". Future's lawyer was referring to the ₹1,400 crore deal between Amazon and Future Coupons, which Amazon has cited to block the deal between Future and Reliance Retail. "We are hanging by a thread...No one wants to do business with us now," Future's lawyer said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 11th time in 13 days
text: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 11th time in 13 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.41/litre after being increased by 80 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹94.67/litre from ₹93.87/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.41/litre from ₹117.57/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹102.64/litre from ₹101.79/litre.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Gautam Adani's fortune hits $100 billion mark, surpasses Mukesh Ambani's
text: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth has hit the $100 billion mark after surging by nearly $24 billion this year. He's the world's biggest gainer this year and now the world's 10th richest person, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani has overtaken Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani, whose fortune stands at $99 billion, and become Asia's richest person again.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Pradeep Mehra receives ₹2.5 lakh from Shoppers Stop, Kapri shares post
text: Shoppers Stop has given a cheque of ₹2.5 lakh to 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for his mother’s treatment and to accomplish his dream of joining the Indian Army. Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted about this and wrote, "Midnight runner Pradeep Mehra is overwhelmed with all the love and support." Earlier in March, Mehra's video of running in Noida had gone viral.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Infosys to shut Russia office amid pressure over Ukraine war: Reports
text: Indian IT major Infosys is closing its office in Russia after facing pressure to stop operating amid Russia's war with Ukraine, reports said. Earlier, UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak faced questions over his wife Akshata's stake in Infosys, which was co-founded by her father Narayana Murthy. Infosys is trying to find replacement roles abroad for Moscow employees, BBC reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: COVID-19 boosters are essential, we shouldn't delay: Shaw to Health Minister
text: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Sunday and said that announcing booster shots of COVID-19 vaccines can help prevent the wastage of unused stocks. "All healthcare institutions are worried about unused stocks of vaccines that will expire soon," she said, adding that COVID-19 "boosters are essential and we should not delay".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: WHO suspends UN supply of Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine
text: The WHO has suspended the supply through United Nations agencies of Covaxin, the COVID-19 vaccine produced by India's Bharat Biotech. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the suspension is to allow the manufacturer to upgrade facilities and address deficiencies found in an inspection. "The WHO said the vaccine is effective and no safety concerns exist," the reports added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Peace? I hate the word: World's richest person Elon Musk
text: The world's richest person, Elon Musk, on Sunday tweeted, "Peace. Peace? I hate the word. Those who do care about peace (myself aspirationally included) don't need to hear it...And those who don't care about peace? Well..."
